segment.source: This topic specifies the requirements that are necessary to install and run Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 in your environment.
segment.target: This topic specifies the requirements that are necessary to install and run Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 in your environment.

segment.source: The supported configurations in this article apply only to App-V 5.0.
segment.target: The supported configurations in this article apply only to App-V 5.0.

segment.source: For supported configurations that apply to App-V 5.0 Service Packs, see the following web pages:
segment.target: For supported configurations that apply to App-V 5.0 Service Packs, see the following web pages:

segment.source: The App-V 5.0 server does not support the following scenarios:
segment.target: The App-V 5.0 server does not support the following scenarios:

segment.source: Deployment to a computer that runs Microsoft Windows Server Core.
segment.target: Deployment to a computer that runs Microsoft Windows Server Core.

segment.source: Deployment to a computer that runs a previous version of App-V 5.0 server components.
segment.target: Deployment to a computer that runs a previous version of App-V 5.0 server components.

segment.source: You can install App-V 5.0 side-by-side with the App-V 4.5 Lightweight Streaming Server (LWS) server only.
segment.target: You can install App-V 5.0 side-by-side with the App-V 4.5 Lightweight Streaming Server (LWS) server only.

segment.source: Deployment of App-V 5.0 side-by-side with the App-V 4.5 Application Virtualization Management Service (HWS) server is not supported.
segment.target: Deployment of App-V 5.0 side-by-side with the App-V 4.5 Application Virtualization Management Service (HWS) server is not supported.

segment.source: Deployment to a computer that runs Microsoft SQL Server Express edition.
segment.target: Deployment to a computer that runs Microsoft SQL Server Express edition.

segment.source: Remote deployment of the management server database or the reporting database.
segment.target: Remote deployment of the management server database or the reporting database.

segment.source: The installer must be run directly on the computer running Microsoft SQL for the database installation to succeed.
segment.target: The installer must be run directly on the computer running Microsoft SQL for the database installation to succeed.

segment.source: If you plan to use a short path you must create a new volume.
segment.target: If you plan to use a short path you must create a new volume.

segment.source: The following table lists the operating systems that are supported for the App-V 5.0 management server installation.
segment.target: The following table lists the operating systems that are supported for the App-V 5.0 management server installation.

segment.source: Microsoft provides support for the current service pack and, in some cases, the immediately preceding service pack.
segment.target: Microsoft provides support for the current service pack and, in some cases, the immediately preceding service pack.

segment.source: To find the support timelines for your product, see the Lifecycle Supported Service Packs.
segment.target: To find the support timelines for your product, see the Lifecycle Supported Service Packs.

segment.source: For additional information about Microsoft Support Lifecycle Policy, see Microsoft Support Lifecycle Support Policy FAQ.
segment.target: For additional information about Microsoft Support Lifecycle Policy, see Microsoft Support Lifecycle Support Policy FAQ.

segment.source: Microsoft Windows Server 2008 (Standard, Enterprise, Datacenter, or Web Server)
segment.target: Microsoft Windows Server 2008 (Standard, Enterprise, Datacenter, or Web Server)

segment.source: Deployment of the management server role to a computer with Remote Desktop Sharing (RDS) enabled is not supported.
segment.target: Deployment of the management server role to a computer with Remote Desktop Sharing (RDS) enabled is not supported.

segment.source: Disk space—200 MB available hard disk space, not including the content directory.
segment.target: Disk space—200 MB available hard disk space, not including the content directory.

segment.source: The following App-V client installation scenarios are not supported, except as noted:
segment.target: The following App-V client installation scenarios are not supported, except as noted:

segment.source: Computers that run App-V 4.6 SP1 or earlier versions
segment.target: Computers that run App-V 4.6 SP1 or earlier versions

segment.source: The App-V 5.0 Remote Desktop services client is supported only for RDS-enabled servers
segment.target: The App-V 5.0 Remote Desktop services client is supported only for RDS-enabled servers

segment.source: The following list displays the supported hardware configuration for the App-V 5.0 client installation.
segment.target: The following list displays the supported hardware configuration for the App-V 5.0 client installation.

segment.source: Processor— 1.4 GHz or faster 32-bit (x86) or 64-bit (x64) processor
segment.target: Processor— 1.4 GHz or faster 32-bit (x86) or 64-bit (x64) processor

segment.source: Disk— 100 MB for installation, not including the disk space that is used by virtualized applications.
segment.target: Disk— 100 MB for installation, not including the disk space that is used by virtualized applications.

segment.source: Supported versions of System Center Configuration Manager
segment.target: Supported versions of System Center Configuration Manager

segment.source: You can use Microsoft System Center 2012 Configuration Manager or System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager to manage App-V virtual applications, reporting, and other functions.
segment.target: You can use Microsoft System Center 2012 Configuration Manager or System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager to manage App-V virtual applications, reporting, and other functions.

segment.source: The following table lists the supported versions of Configuration Manager for each applicable version of App-V.
segment.target: The following table lists the supported versions of Configuration Manager for each applicable version of App-V.

segment.source: For more information about how Configuration Manager integrates with App-V, see Planning for App-V Integration with Configuration Manager.
segment.target: For more information about how Configuration Manager integrates with App-V, see Planning for App-V Integration with Configuration Manager.
